description: Read the full text of President Biden's letter withdrawing from the race to be the Democratic nominee and his endorsement of Vice President Kamala Harris to represent the party instead.
title: Want to know what Biden said when he dropped out? The full letter is here.

description: After President Biden announced he would no longer seek the Democratic nomination for president, he endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris. Harris said she wants to unite the Democratic Party.
title: Kamala Harris pledges to 'earn and win' the nomination after Biden's endorsement

description: Democrats on Capitol hill are praising President Biden for ending his campaign for President but Republican leaders are using the decision to call for Biden to resign.
title: Hill Democrats praise Biden's leadership while Republicans call on him to step down

description: President Biden says he is withdrawing from the presidential race and endorsing Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: President Biden is stepping down from the presidential race

description: The American rock musician and former paratrooper was arrested last year on drug trafficking charges.
title: Russia sentences American Michael Travis Leake to 13 years on alleged drug charges

description: The former president and JD Vance made their campaign trail debut at a rally in Michigan on Saturday, as they seek to claw back a state that Trump won in 2016 but which Biden took in 2020.
title: In his first campaign rally with Vance, Trump says he took 'a bullet for democracy'

description: Israeli jets bombed Yemen's Red Sea port of Hodeidah, igniting huge fires and inflicting substantial damage. Israel says the port is where Houthi fighters received many of their weapons from Iran.
title: Israel says airstrike in Yemen will block weapons to Houthi militia

description: Extreme temperatures have caused problems for the beverage service on some Southwest Airlines flights, with hot cans exploding when opened.
title: Southwest Airlines is facing a unique climate change problem: exploding soda cans

description: The war in Gaza has brought Sunni and Shiite armed groups closer together in Lebanon. Many there fear that fighting on its border with Israel could drag the country into war.
title: At the funeral of a senior Hamas leader, pride and hope for the future

description: What does the death of the long-serving leader of Vietnam, one of the world's last remaining communist regimes, mean for the country and the region?
title: Vietnam's most senior political leader has died, leaving behind a vacuum in the party

description: We look at how the CrowdStrike update, which caused a major comms outage for airlines and banks, affected hospitals.
title: The Crowdstrike outage disrupted many industries. Hospitals were especially vulnerable

description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks with political pundit Charlie Sykes about his take on the state of the presidential race, now between conventions.
title: A political analyst explains what's next for the presidential race

description: Just a few miles away where the GOP vice presidential candidate J.D. Vance spoke at the convention in Milwaukee about the tragedy of addiction, people at a health clinic hope for more than promises.
title: J.D. Vance pledged to address addiction. Patients at a nearby clinic hope he's serious

description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe speaks with Stefano Schiavon, a professor at University of California, Berkeley, on the benefits of using fans in conjunction with air conditioners.
title: How to keep cool while saving energy (and money)

description: We look at former president Donald Trump's rally in Michigan - the first one since the assassination attempt on him and the first one with his new running mate, Ohio Sen. J.D. Vance.
title: Trump addresses his first rally since the assassination attempt

description: A program in Ukraine trains women to drive buses and large trucks — jobs typically dominated by men. But the ongoing conflict with Russia is reshaping Ukraine's economy, its job market and who is available to work.
title: Women in Ukraine are taking over traditionally male-dominated work as the war goes on

description: Startups are catering to mourners who want a way to communicate with their lost loved ones — or at least digital likeness of them.
title: Chinese companies offer to 'resurrect' deceased loved ones with AI avatars

description: More than 250 people have died since 2013 when trenches they were working in caved in. In most cases, the employers failed to follow basic government regulations for making trenches safe.
title: Trench collapses have killed hundreds of workers in the U.S. over the last decade
